intro: Lobelia chinensis var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered Chinese lobelia, is a perennial herb native to China. It features showy, tubular white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
